item.description:
Meet your local "locavore" Alison LePage. Alison and her family have embarked on a local eating effort - trying to source nearly all their foods from within 100 miles. Hear about Alison's efforts and think about wheather a 100-mile diet would work for you!

Here's a link to Alison's blog: http://localfoodie.li...


Potluck to start at 6:30
Presentation/Discussion to start around 7:00 or 7:15
Try to wrap up around 8:30

POTLUCK NOTE: We may not have access to plugs for crockpots ... When I get there I will try to move the potluck table close to a wall with power, but just in case, you may want to warm hot foods just prior to heading over to Zero Station!

Potluck breakdown:
Last name starting with A-G bring whatever you want
Last name starting with H-M bring bread or beverage
Last name starting with N-S main or side dish to share
Last name starting with T-Z bring salad or veg or dessert

*NEW* Don't forget to bring your own potluck kit of plate/bowl/cup/utensils/cloth napkin - we're trying to move away from disposable or even compostable stuff!

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: December Meetup: The 100-Mile Diet
